pages.title: CRAFTED | A Multi‑Day Celebration of Culinary Creativity, Tastings & Makers Markets
pages.content: Title: CRAFTED | A Multi‑Day Celebration of Culinary Creativity, Tastings & Makers Markets Description: Crafted invites you into a multi-day journey of culinary expression, spirited tastings, and hands-on discovery. From elegant soirées to inspired makers markets, each event celebrates the creativity of chefs, distillers, designers, and craftspeople from across the country. Whether you’re savoring a firkin-poured ale or discovering handmade wares, every moment is designed to delight. ## CRAFTED ## CRAFTED ## CRAFTED ## Celebrating the stories that craft tells. ## November 12–16, 2025 | Alys Beach, Florida ## A Weekend to Savor ## Signature Experiences ## Schedule ## With Gratitude to Our Sponsors ## Supporting the Arts ## CRAFTED ### Firkin Fête ### Holiday Makers Market ### Spirited Soirée ### Pickleball & Picklebacks Crafted invites you into a multi-day journey of culinary expression, spirited tastings, and hands-on discovery. From elegant soirées to inspired makers markets, each event celebrates the creativity of chefs, distillers, designers, and craftspeople from across the country. Whether you’re savoring a firkin-poured ale or discovering handmade wares, every moment is designed to delight. From lively tastings to thoughtful markets, Crafted offers a collection of unforgettable gatherings. Explore these featured events and discover your favorites. An intimate tasting event featuring rare firkin cask ales, craft brews, and paired bites from local chefs. A curated marketplace of handmade goods, fine crafts, and seasonal gifts from talented artisans. An elevated afternoon of cocktails, live music, and culinary delights along the scenic Pedestrian Path at Alys Beach. A playful morning of friendly competition and briny refreshment—yes, pickleback shots included. Plan your perfect weekend. Whether you're sipping rare spirits, browsing handmade goods, or enjoying the delightful afternoon soiree, each day of Crafted is thoughtfully designed to inspire, delight, and connect. Explore the full lineup of events and start curating your experience. Tuesday, November 11th, 2025 5 PM NEAT Bottle Shop & Tasting Room Wednesday, November 12th, 2025 5:30 PM Red Loggia at Caliza Thursday, November 13th, 2025 5 PM Red Loggia at Caliza 5 PM Fonville Press 5 PM Papilio Park Friday, November 14th, 2025 1 PM North Sea Garden Walk 2 - 4:30 PM Alys Beach Amphitheatre 6:30 - 9 PM Central Park Saturday, November 15th, 2025 10 AM - 2 PM Alys Beach Amphitheatre 11 AM Splash Pad at the Alys Beach Amphitheatre 1 PM - 4 PM North Sea Garden Walk Sunday, November 16th, 2025 10 AM - 2 PM Alys Beach Amphitheatre 11 AM Splash Pad at the Alys Beach Amphitheatre 12 - 3 PM Racquet Courts at ZUMA Crafted is made possible through the generous support of our sponsors. These visionary partners share our passion for creativity, culture, and community. We are honored to collaborate with them to bring this unforgettable weekend to life. The Cultural Arts Alliance of Walton County has been the creative core of the local community for three decades – 30 years of fostering creativity as a local arts agency in Walton County, Florida. Website Design by INFLUENCE OCEAN

From elegant soirées to inspired makers markets, each event celebrates the creativity of chefs, distillers, designers, and craftspeople from across the country. Whether you’re savoring a firkin-poured ale or discovering handmade wares, every moment is designed to delight.

pages.title: Children’s Be the Maker Workshop with Marilu Doodles | CRAFTED
pages.content: Title: Children’s Be the Maker Workshop with Marilu Doodles | CRAFTED # Children’s Be the Maker Workshop with Marilu Doodles ## CRAFTED ## CRAFTED ## CRAFTED ### Sunday, November 16, 2025 ### 11 AM ### Splash Pad at the Alys Beach Amphitheatre This special edition of the Be the Maker series is for the kids! While you enjoy exploring the Holiday Makers Market, we invite your children to join artist Marilu Morgan of Marilu Doodles for an Alys Beach Crafted edition of her beloved Craft Club. In this hands-on workshop, young makers will craft their very own custom canvas stocking—perfect for adding a personal touch to their room or seasonal décor. With Marilu’s expert guidance, they will paint and personalize a canvas stocking, embellish with bits and bobbles, and all the while learn simple but foundational design techniques. While your family may already have its set of cherished holiday stockings, this custom keepsake is sure to capture a moment in each child’s artistic expression – their time in Alys Beach, their favorite holiday traditions, or simply their favorite childhood delights. A cheerful, festive, creative experience to commemorate time spent in this special place. This Be the Maker Workshop is limited to ages 5-18. IMPORTANT INFO Where Alys Beach Town Center Amphitheatre – Splash Pad When Sunday, November 16, 2025 | 11AM Age Children ages 5-18 Dress Code Please note this workshop is creative & messy – you may get paint on your clothes. Food / Drink Food and drink available to purchase from Town Center Merchants Environment Outdoors, Interactive Workshop Event Advisories Event occurs rain or shine. ADDITIONAL FESTIVAL POLICIES Tickets are non-refundable and non-transferable between events. ADDITIONAL NOTICE NO PETS ALLOWED. ONLY SERVICE ANIMALS PERMITTED. Service animals are defined as dogs that are individually trained to do work or perform tasks for people with disabilities. Website Design by INFLUENCE OCEAN

pages.title: Holiday Makers Market Sunday | CRAFTED
pages.content: Title: Holiday Makers Market Sunday | CRAFTED # Holiday Makers Market ## CRAFTED ## CRAFTED ## CRAFTED ### Sunday, November 16, 2025 ### 10 AM - 2 PM ### Alys Beach Amphitheatre Join us in the Alys Beach Amphitheatre on Friday, November 14, 2025 from 2 – 4:30 pm, Saturday, November 15 from 10 am – 2 pm and Sunday, November 16 from 10 am – 2 pm for the Alys Beach Crafted Holiday Makers Market. This collection of thoughtfully selected artisans will showcase their craft, their inspiration, and their stories with product representing the best in regional workmanship. Guests are invited to stroll through the Amphitheatre in Alys Beach Town Center to peruse the works of these makers, available to purchase and specially curated as gifts for loved ones, for the home, or for oneself, will be available for purchase as folks shop through the Amphitheatre in pursuit of beautifully curated gifts for their loved ones in preparation for the upcoming holidays. Enjoy live music while perusing the Makers Market and enjoy a selection of treats and refreshments available for purchase from surrounding Merchants. Photos with Santa will be available at select times during the Holiday Makers Market. This event is free and open to the public. IMPORTANT INFO Where Alys Beach Town Center Amphitheatre When Sunday, November 16, 2025 | 10AM-2PM Age All ages, and dogs, welcome Dress Code Come as you are! Food / Drink Food and drink available to purchase from Town Center Merchants Environment Outdoors, Walkable Music Saunders Boyz 10AM-2PM Photos with Santa 12PM-2PM Event Advisories Event occurs rain or shine. ADDITIONAL FESTIVAL POLICIES Tickets are non-refundable and non-transferable between events. ADDITIONAL NOTICE NO PETS ALLOWED. ONLY SERVICE ANIMALS PERMITTED. Service animals are defined as dogs that are individually trained to do work or perform tasks for people with disabilities. Website Design by INFLUENCE OCEAN

pages.title: Be the Maker Workshop with Sugarbird 30A | CRAFTED
pages.content: Title: Be the Maker Workshop with Sugarbird 30A | CRAFTED # Be the Maker Workshop with Sugarbird 30A ## CRAFTED ## CRAFTED ## CRAFTED ### Saturday, November 15, 2025 ### 11 AM ### Splash Pad at the Alys Beach Amphitheatre Join Sugarbird 30A for a beautifully curated Be the Maker workshop, celebrating the delicate, whimsical artistry of pressed florals. With an abundant array of blooms and botanical textures at your fingertips, Sonnie and Emily will walk you through creating your own one-of-a-kind floral composition using the time-honored process of pressing flowers. This intimate gathering invites cheerful creativity and camaraderie, complemented by light bites, refreshments, and thoughtful guidance in technique and design. Each participant will create an 8” X 8” pressed floral arrangement, elegantly framed – an artful keepsake to gift or to grace a special space in your own home. IMPORTANT INFO Where Alys Beach Town Center Amphitheatre – Splash Pad When Saturday, November 15, 2025 | 11AM Age 18 & up Dress Code Please note this workshop is creative & messy – you may get paint on your clothes. Food / Drink Food and drink available to purchase from Town Center Merchants Environment Outdoors, Interactive Workshop Event Advisories Event occurs rain or shine. ADDITIONAL FESTIVAL POLICIES Tickets are non-refundable and non-transferable between events. ADDITIONAL NOTICE NO PETS ALLOWED. ONLY SERVICE ANIMALS PERMITTED. pages.title: Architectural Tour  | CRAFTED
pages.content: Title: Architectural Tour | CRAFTED # Architectural Tour ## CRAFTED ## CRAFTED ## CRAFTED ### Friday, November 14, 2025 ### 1 PM ### North Sea Garden Walk Walk the pedestrian paths and alleys of Alys Beach with Marieanne Khoury-Vogt, Alys Beach Town Architect and full-time resident of 20+ years alongside husband and partner, Erik Vogt. Marieanne and Erik have shepherded the master planned vision of the town, helping to define a new architectural language informed by the resilience of Bermuda and the classical traditions of the Mediterranean, enhanced by their own inclinations toward Moorish influences and detailing inspired by their travels and connections to different parts of the world. You’re sure to see Alys through new eyes as you learn more about the intentionality behind every detail and hear about the intensely thoughtful planning of the town. Walking through Alys Beach, Marieanne will share the stories behind the craft of architectural design and the shaping of a town that continues to inspire and captivate, imparting fresh insights into what makes Alys so special. Thank you to Christiana Cabinetry for their partnership in sponsoring this year’s Architectural Tour. IMPORTANT INFO Where North Sea Garden Walk (Entrance of Pedestrian Path is on the north side of 30A between the Alys Beach Sales Center & Fonville Press along West La Garza Lane) When Friday, November 14, 2025 | 1PM Age All ages welcome Dress Code Walking Attire Environment Outdoors, Walking Tour Event Advisories Event occurs rain or shine. ADDITIONAL FESTIVAL POLICIES Tickets are non-refundable and non-transferable between events. ADDITIONAL NOTICE NO PETS ALLOWED. ONLY SERVICE ANIMALS PERMITTED. Service animals are defined as dogs that are individually trained to do work or perform tasks for people with disabilities. Website Design by INFLUENCE OCEAN

pages.title: Jose Medina Camacho with Heavy Met’l Imports + Alys Beach Culinary | CRAFTED
pages.content: Title: Jose Medina Camacho with Heavy Met’l Imports + Alys Beach Culinary | CRAFTED # Experiential Dinner: Jose Medina Camacho with Heavy Met’l Imports + Alys Beach Culinary ## CRAFTED ## CRAFTED ## CRAFTED ### Thursday, November 13, 2025 ### 5 PM ### Papilio Park Set beneath the stars and the olive trees of Papilio Park, this Experiential Mixology Dinner pairs James Beard Finalist Jose Medina Camacho of Salud Taqueria and Adios Bar (Birmingham, AL) with the tequila and Mexican rums of Heavy Met’l Premium Imports (Austin, TX) alongside the talents of Alys Beach Culinary. Expect a spirited journey through the bold, expressive landscapes of Oaxaca, Jalisco, and beyond as this colorful crew paints a bold, freshly approached, and thoughtfully composed collection of dishes and beverages, connecting us with their stories and inspirations along the way. pages.title: Brown Foreman and featured Crafted Mixologists + Fonville Press | CRAFTED
pages.content: Title: Brown Foreman and featured Crafted Mixologists + Fonville Press | CRAFTED # Experiential Dinner: Barrels Worth Knowing presented by Brown-Forman + Fonville Press ## CRAFTED ## CRAFTED ## CRAFTED ### Thursday, November 13, 2025 ### 5 PM ### Fonville Press Brown-Forman and its premium spirits portfolio will team up with the Fonville Press bar to present a fresh, innovative cocktail experience featuring world-famous brands Jack Daniel’s, Woodford Reserve, Tequila Herradura, and Diplomático Rum. With a multi-course dinner from the talented Fonville Press team, paired with Crafted mixologists' cocktails, guests can settle in for a warm, inspiring evening, showcasing some of Crafted’s most creative and talented personalities. This immersive cocktail dinner promises an elevated night of fun, bringing together a community of shared talent and genuine joy in gathering good people around the table. pages.title: Boat Drinks + Worthy Park Estate Rum | CRAFTED
pages.content: Title: Boat Drinks + Worthy Park Estate Rum | CRAFTED # Experiential Dinner: Boat Drinks + Worthy Park Estate Rum ## CRAFTED ## CRAFTED ## CRAFTED ### Thursday, November 13, 2025 ### 5 PM ### Red Loggia at Caliza Take a vacation (from your vacation) with this Experiential Dinner presented by Boat Drinks (St. Augustine, FL) and Worthy Park's (Lluidas Vale, Jamaica) award-winning rums. The warm glow of Caliza's Reg Loggia is the tropical evening backdrop to explore the authentic Jamaican rums of Worthy Park, led by Whitney Hobbs (Boat Drinks) and Zan Kong (Worthy Park). You'll learn how to look beyond color and proof to explore the true markers of rum style, flavor and character. Come prepared to challenge the old cliches about rum and discover one of the most diverse spirit categories in the world! Just like in Jamaica, when there is good rum, there is good food. Boat Drink's Captain, Rob Crabtree, will be at the culinary helm to take you on a tour of tropical delights spanning the Caribbean and the Gulf Coast. All the while you'll have frosty, tropical cocktails in hand, and you'll understand why we say "Boat Drinks is a state of mind!” IMPORTANT INFO Where Red Loggia at Caliza When Thursday, November 13, 2025 | 5PM Age 21 years of age and older Dress Code Tropical Cocktail Food / Drink All food and drink included Environment Outdoors, Seated Dinner Event Advisories Event occurs rain or shine. ADDITIONAL FESTIVAL POLICIES Tickets are non-refundable and non-transferable between events. ADDITIONAL NOTICE NO PETS ALLOWED. ONLY SERVICE ANIMALS PERMITTED. pages.title: Songwriter Round Table Session with David Ryan Harris + Chris Stills | CRAFTED
pages.content: Title: Songwriter Round Table Session with David Ryan Harris + Chris Stills | CRAFTED # Songwriter Round Table Session with David Ryan Harris + Chris Stills ## CRAFTED ## CRAFTED ## CRAFTED ### Wednesday, November 12, 2025 ### 5:30 PM ### Red Loggia at Caliza In partnership with the beneficiary of Alys Beach Crafted, the Cultural Arts Alliance of Walton County (CAA), we are proud to present a new event that pays homage to the CAA’s signature event, the 30A Songwriters Festival. The Songwriters Round Table will feature American singer-songwriters and 30A Songwriters Festival favorites, David Ryan Harris and Chris Stills . Cozy up in the Red Loggia at Caliza and listen to the sweet sounds of two renowned musicians, enjoying the stories behind the lyrics as you experience this intimate showcase. Beverages and light bites will be provided. Thank you to St. Augustine Distillery Co. for their partnership in sponsoring the beverages for this evening. IMPORTANT INFO Where Red Loggia at Caliza When Wednesday, November 12, 2025 | 5:30PM Age 21 years of age and older Dress Code Casual Food / Drink All food and drink included Environment Outdoors, Seated Music Alex Rogers , Chris Stills & David Ryan Harris Event Advisories Event occurs rain or shine. pages.title: Café Brulot Demonstration + The Obituary Cocktail Book Signing with Sue Strachan | CRAFTED
pages.content: Title: Café Brulot Demonstration + The Obituary Cocktail Book Signing with Sue Strachan | CRAFTED # Fired Up at NEAT: A Special Crafted Edition of Wine & Song ## CRAFTED ## CRAFTED ## CRAFTED ### Tuesday, November 11, 2025 ### 5 PM ### NEAT Bottle Shop & Tasting Room Legendary New Orleans Cocktails with Author Sue Strachan NEAT | Tuesday, November 11 | 5-7 PM Sue Strachan, author of The Café Brûlot presents her new book, The Obituary Cocktail , with a Café Brulot demonstration. This complimentary event will get the Crafted spirits flowing to kick off the week’s events. Join author Sue Strachan as she shares the stories behind some of New Orleans’ classic cocktails, Café Brûlot and The Obituary Cocktail, while viewing a fiery demonstration of the dramatic Café Brûlot cocktail. The Obituary Cocktail features a blend of gin, vermouth, and absinthe in a spirited honoring of funerary tradition rooted in New Orleans’ clandestine history of “secret societies, second-line parades, and celebrations of deathly holidays like Halloween and All Saints’ Day.” Café Brûlot exemplifies New Orleans’ love for the dramatic with a theatrical presentation that holds as much weight as the libation itself. A concoction of coffee, brandy, sugar, cinnamon, lemon, oranges, cloves and sometimes an orange liqueur, the cocktail is served in a special Brûlot cup and set aflame in a highly ceremonial preparation that requires its own specialty tools and expertise. Born of legend and enduring through the centuries, the old-line restaurants of New Orleans — Antoine’s, Arnaud’s, Brennan’s, Broussard’s, Commander’s Palace and Galatoire’s — continue the tradition of this “devilishly incendiary coffee,” also known as Café Brûlot Diabolique. This special “Crafted” edition of NEAT’s weekly Wine & Song event is complimentary and open to the public with live music and opportunities to purchase The Obituary Cocktail and the Café Brûlot cocktail after the demonstration. Strahan’s books on these legendary cocktails and the New Orleans history and cultural insights around them will be available for purchase, with a book signing from 5-7PM. Website Design by INFLUENCE OCEAN

pages.title: Pickleball & Picklebacks | CRAFTED
pages.content: Title: Pickleball & Picklebacks | CRAFTED # Pickleball & Picklebacks ## CRAFTED ## CRAFTED ## CRAFTED ### Sunday, November 16, 2025 ### 12 - 3 PM ### Racquet Courts at ZUMA Join fellow spectators at the 2nd Annual Pickleball & Picklebacks event, held at ZUMA Wellness Center on Sunday, November 16th from 12-3 pm with 8 teams of two participating in the pickleball tournament. As the finale for Alys Beach Crafted’s week of events, Pickleball & Picklebacks will feature an expansive brunch spread from Alys Beach Culinary in addition to pickle inspired cocktails and, of course, the namesake pickleback (traditionally a shot of neat whiskey chased with a shot of pickle brine). A full bar will be available, as well. Please note, if interested in participating in the pickleball tournament, a pickleball team is a separate cost. IMPORTANT INFO Where ZUMA Wellness Center Racquet Courts When Sunday, November 16, 2025 | 12-3PM Age 21 years of age and older Dress Code Sporty Casual Food / Drink All food and drink included Environment Outdoors Music Sunshine Wranglers Band Event Advisories Event occurs rain or shine. pages.title: Spirited Soirée | CRAFTED
pages.content: Title: Spirited Soirée | CRAFTED # Spirited Soirée ## CRAFTED ## CRAFTED ## CRAFTED ### Saturday, November 15, 2025 ### 1 PM - 4 PM ### North Sea Garden Walk Spirited Soirée features an extensive gallery of cocktails crafted collaboratively in the pairing of specially selected mixologists and small-batch craft distilleries. On Saturday, November 15, 2025, from 1-4 pm, guests will have the opportunity to taste both the neat spirits and the crafted cocktail as each mixologist-distillery team reveals insights into the process and inspiration behind their creations. Enjoy specialty canapés, light bites, and desserts from the best culinary teams in the Southeast as you explore the vast collection of hand-crafted cocktails and spirits, and take home some of the new concepts, trends, and products currently setting the beverage world a-buzz. pages.title: Firkin Fête  | CRAFTED
pages.content: Title: Firkin Fête | CRAFTED # Firkin Fête ## CRAFTED ## CRAFTED ## CRAFTED ### Friday, November 14, 2025 ### 6:30 - 9 PM ### Central Park Join us for our 5th Annual Firkin Fête on Friday, November 14, 2025 from 6:30-9 pm in Central Park. Firkin Fête features a unique tasting experience as we tap firkins of beer created by local and regional breweries. The firkins, each an 11-gallon keg, are unique in that no one, including the brewers themselves, can know what the final product will taste like until the firkins are tapped for the event. Firkin Fête will also feature the culinary creations of chefs from throughout the southeast and live music performances from powerhouse NOLA soul group, J & the Causeways . This festive evening is not to be missed! IMPORTANT INFO Where Central Park at Alys Beach When Friday, November 14, 2025 | 6:30-9PM Age 21 years of age and older Dress Code Casual, Flat shoes recommended Food / Drink All food and drink included Environment Outdoors, Walkabout Music J & the Causeways Event Advisories Event occurs rain or shine. pages.title: FAQ | CRAFTED
pages.content: Title: | CRAFTED # ## CRAFTED ## CRAFTED ## How do I purchase tickets? ## Where do I park ## What do I wear? ## Where can I find information about each event? ## Which nonprofit organization does Alys Beach Crafted benefit? ## What does rain or shine mean? ## What am I allowed to bring into the festival? ## CRAFTED Tickets go on sale to Alys Beach Homeowners on August 14th, 2025 and to the public on September 2nd, 2025. Tickets can only be purchased online. Dependent on availability, some tickets may be sold at the door. Parking is available on-site at Alys Beach. The best location is the Amphitheatre, located at the corner of Hwy 30A and Somerset Street. Signs will direct traffic to additional parking areas. The festival is a casual affair. Ladies, flat shoes are recommended, as there is a lot of walking throughout the festival on cobblestone pathways and lawn spaces. And, don’t forget your best pickleball ‘fit for Sunday’s Pickleball & Picklebacks event! The schedule page has all the information regarding each event. The Cultural Arts Alliance Every effort will be made for the festival to go on despite inclement weather (i.e., rain, storms, etc.) within reason. If extreme weather, such as high winds or a hurricane, poses threat to our guests or equipment, then the event will not move forward and tickets will be refunded if a mandatory evacuation is in place. Purses and bags are permitted and will be checked upon entry. Alcohol, chairs, weapons, and firearms are not permissible. Cameras are permitted for personal/non-commercial use only. For professional photography and video use, prior approval is required. Please contact events@alysbeach.com for advance approval. Ticketed events are 21+ with the exception of the Be the Maker Workshops. Pets & strollers are not permitted at ticketed events; they are welcome in the Alys Beach Amphitheatre at the Holiday Makers Market. Website Design by INFLUENCE OCEAN

pages.title: Cultural Arts Alliance | CRAFTED
pages.content: Title: Cultural Arts Alliance | CRAFTED ## CRAFTED ## CRAFTED ## Supporting the Arts ## CRAFTED The Cultural Arts Alliance of Walton County has been the creative core of the local community for three decades – 30 years of fostering creativity as a local arts agency in Walton County, Florida. Supporting the arts through leadership, advocacy, funding, programs, and education, the CAA’s mission is to encourage and promote creativity. With an emphasis on inclusivity and collaboration, the CAA provides opportunities for residents and visitors to experience diverse forms of art and learning, connecting them to broad, critical explorations through artistic expression and engagement. ​ The Alys Foundation and Alys Beach are committed to providing cultural experiences for the broader Alys Beach Community, including creative programming, a permanent collection of art works displayed throughout the town’s landscape, and through partnerships with organizations like the Cultural Arts Alliance. Alys Beach Crafted is delighted to support the CAA while sharing the stories that craft tells. Website Design by INFLUENCE OCEAN

pages.title: CRAFTED | A Multi‑Day Celebration of Culinary Creativity, Tastings & Makers Markets
pages.content: Title: CRAFTED | A Multi‑Day Celebration of Culinary Creativity, Tastings & Makers Markets Description: Crafted invites you into a multi-day journey of culinary expression, spirited tastings, and hands-on discovery. From elegant soirées to inspired makers markets, each event celebrates the creativity of chefs, distillers, designers, and craftspeople from across the country. Whether you’re savoring a firkin-poured ale or discovering handmade wares, every moment is designed to delight. ## CRAFTED ## CRAFTED ## CRAFTED ## Celebrating the stories that craft tells. ## November 12–16, 2025 | Alys Beach, Florida ## A Weekend to Savor ## Signature Experiences ## Schedule ## With Gratitude to Our Sponsors ## Supporting the Arts ## CRAFTED ### Firkin Fête ### Holiday Makers Market ### Spirited Soirée ### Pickleball & Picklebacks Crafted invites you into a multi-day journey of culinary expression, spirited tastings, and hands-on discovery. From elegant soirées to inspired makers markets, each event celebrates the creativity of chefs, distillers, designers, and craftspeople from across the country. Whether you’re savoring a firkin-poured ale or discovering handmade wares, every moment is designed to delight. From lively tastings to thoughtful markets, Crafted offers a collection of unforgettable gatherings. Explore these featured events and discover your favorites. An intimate tasting event featuring rare firkin cask ales, craft brews, and paired bites from local chefs. A curated marketplace of handmade goods, fine crafts, and seasonal gifts from talented artisans. An elevated afternoon of cocktails, live music, and culinary delights along the scenic Pedestrian Path at Alys Beach. A playful morning of friendly competition and briny refreshment—yes, pickleback shots included. Plan your perfect weekend. Whether you're sipping rare spirits, browsing handmade goods, or enjoying the delightful afternoon soiree, each day of Crafted is thoughtfully designed to inspire, delight, and connect. Explore the full lineup of events and start curating your experience. Tuesday, November 11th, 2025 5 PM NEAT Bottle Shop & Tasting Room Wednesday, November 12th, 2025 5:30 PM Red Loggia at Caliza Thursday, November 13th, 2025 5 PM Red Loggia at Caliza 5 PM Fonville Press 5 PM Papilio Park Friday, November 14th, 2025 1 PM North Sea Garden Walk 2 - 4:30 PM Alys Beach Amphitheatre 6:30 - 9 PM Central Park Saturday, November 15th, 2025 10 AM - 2 PM Alys Beach Amphitheatre 11 AM Splash Pad at the Alys Beach Amphitheatre 1 PM - 4 PM North Sea Garden Walk Sunday, November 16th, 2025 10 AM - 2 PM Alys Beach Amphitheatre 11 AM Splash Pad at the Alys Beach Amphitheatre 12 - 3 PM Racquet Courts at ZUMA Crafted is made possible through the generous support of our sponsors. These visionary partners share our passion for creativity, culture, and community. We are honored to collaborate with them to bring this unforgettable weekend to life. The Cultural Arts Alliance of Walton County has been the creative core of the local community for three decades – 30 years of fostering creativity as a local arts agency in Walton County, Florida. Website Design by INFLUENCE OCEAN
pages.meta_description: Crafted invites you into a multi-day journey of culinary expression, spirited tastings, and hands-on discovery. From elegant soirées to inspired makers markets, each event celebrates the creativity of chefs, distillers, designers, and craftspeople from across the country. Whether you’re savoring a firkin-poured ale or discovering handmade wares, every moment is designed to delight.

pages.title: Alys Beach: Luxury Gulf Coast Community
pages.content: Alys Beach is a luxury seaside community located on Florida's 30A Gulf Coast, positioned as a destination offering 'life defined' through carefully curated design, amenities, and community experience. The community emphasizes four key principles: Beauty - Quiet, pristine beaches and natural beauty are accentuated by the world's most thoughtful architects and designers. The architectural aesthetic features distinctive white stucco structures with filtered light creating shadowed art at every turn. Balance - The design represents a study in geometry with stark white structures against cerulean skies, creating purposeful spaces for community life. Simplicity - Through careful consideration, daily life is streamlined with intentionally crafted experiences. Grace - The community positions itself as offering peace of mind, contentment, and inner awareness of simple elegance. Key Amenities include: The Beach with white sand beachfront for relaxation and water activities; Caliza Pool, an exotic oasis with cooling waters and shaded areas; ZUMA Wellness Center, fitness and restoration facility emphasizing balance; Dining & Shopping with curated restaurants and merchants catering to discerning tastes; Events including 30A Wine Festival and Digital Graffiti. The community offers vacation rental properties and residential ownership opportunities, including developments like Somersisle Terrace (rowhouse living) and The Dannelly & Varian. Contact: 850-213-5500 (General) | 850-213-5555 (Rentals). Location: 9581 County Hwy 30A East, Alys Beach, FL 32461

pages.title: Alys Beach Real Estate
pages.content: To build a life at Alys Beach is to join a community designed for joy, beauty, and life abundant. The Real Estate section describes the custom home-building experience through their Sales, Construction, and Design teams. Key sections include: Why Alys - Features a gallery showcasing community architecture, beach amenities, and lifestyle imagery. The Process - Describes the custom home-building experience. Alys Insider - A quarterly e-newsletter offering market updates and ownership information; Spring 2025 issue available. Construction Standards - Alys Beach requires all homes meet Fortified… for safer living® certification and maintains an in-house construction company. Somerset Program - Coordinates architects, sales, and construction for streamlined custom home design. The Beach Club - An exclusive, owners-only amenity featuring pools, dining, lounge areas, and Gulf views. Owner Services - Provides 24/7 security, technology support, housekeeping, maintenance, and property inspection programs. Contact: 850-213-5500 (General) | 850-213-5555 (Rentals). Address: 9581 County Hwy 30A East, Alys Beach, Florida 32461

pages.title: Real Estate Properties – Alys Beach
pages.content: Real estate properties listing page for Alys Beach, a New Urbanist coastal community in Florida. The site features a property listings interface with filtering capabilities and two viewing modes: Listing view (default) and Map view. Filter Options Available: The page allows users to narrow searches by bedrooms, bathrooms, half baths, location (North/South of 30A), property type (Home, Condominium, Homesite, Somerset Home), and status (For Sale, New Listings, Under Contract, Sold). Featured Listings: The page displays approximately 20+ properties with prices ranging from $1.7M to $13.5M, including properties like: EE7-Mose Alley ($1,725,000), C6-140 North Charles Street ($9,995,000), XX2-20 Fairwind Lane ($12,550,000). Community Description: To be a part of the Alys Beach community is to become one with a life defined by excellence and beauty, emphasizing intentional design throughout the town. Contact: General: 850.213.5500 | Rentals: 850.213.5555. Address: 9581 County Hwy 30A East, Alys Beach, Florida 32461

pages.title: The Dannelly & Varian – Alys Beach
pages.content: The Dannelly & Varian represents a luxury condominium development in Alys Beach's Town Center. The project comprises 18 total residences designed by architect Michael G. Imber. Development Composition: The community includes six 3-bedroom and twelve 2-bedroom units. Phase 2 offers nine residences with pricing ranging from approximately $3.2 million to $5.1 million depending on configuration and bedroom count. Location & Design: Situated at the northeast end of the Amphitheatre among restaurants and shops, the development emphasizes the liveliness and luxury of Alys Beach's New Urbanist design principles. The project follows a successful initial presale release. Amenities & Information: Prospective buyers can access detailed floor plans (separate documents for Dannelly and Varian buildings), architectural elevations, digital brochure, and contact with sales associates via email. Contact Information: Interested parties can reach out to Alys Beach's sales team for purchase opportunities and additional details about available units. The development reflects the broader Alys Beach commitment to architecturally distinctive, community-focused coastal living with premium finishing and sophisticated design standards.

pages.title: Somersisle Terrace – Alys Beach
pages.content: Somersisle Terrace is a residential development located in Alys Beach, Florida. The property represents a prominent architectural feature along the town's main thoroughfare. According to the architects, the development is modeled after the grand Terrace Rows of Georgian London, rising 4 stories above an elevated stoop. The structure features Gulf-facing views and includes four bedroom suites distributed across three floors, with amenities including elevated loggias, courts, and pools. Amenities & Features: Principal suite on the third floor with private porch and balcony; Fourth-floor eastern and western terraces offering panoramic views; Second-floor living spaces with Gulf views; Elevated loggia, court, and pool on the west side for sunset viewing. Location & Contact: Address: 9581 County Hwy 30A East, Alys Beach, Florida 32461. Phone Numbers: General: 850-213-5500 | Rentals: 850-213-5555. Documentation Available: Brochure, Floor plan, Elevation drawings. For pricing information and additional details, prospective buyers can contact the Alys Beach Sales Team directly through the provided contact information or information request form.

pages.title: Phase 4 – Alys Beach
pages.content: Phase 4, specifically the GG Block section of Alys Beach, a residential development in Florida. Location & Contact: The development is situated at 9581 County Hwy 30A East, Alys Beach, Florida 32461. General inquiries can reach the sales team at 850-213-5500, with rental services available at 850-213-5555. Development Description: The GG Block represents a neighborhood designed around natural landscapes. Nature dominates the scene and weaves its way through a varied collection of picturesque homes organized around an expansive wetland park and Nature Preserve. The architectural character emphasizes integration with the environment, featuring white garden walls that open into landscaped courtyards and gardens set against the natural backdrop of greenery and woodland textures. The Silva Amenity: A central feature includes a new community gathering space with a central event lawn, an enclosed pavilion opening onto the lawn, pool, and covered terrace with bar and café. Available Resources: Visitors can access a brochure and phase map for detailed information about the development. A contact form allows interested parties to request more information from the sales team.

pages.title: Alys Beach - Building at Alys
pages.content: This webpage describes the home construction process and standards at Alys Beach, a coastal Florida community. The content emphasizes quality craftsmanship and safety certifications in residential building. Main Message: Building a home at Alys Beach means building with excellence, whether through the community's in-house construction team or approved building partners. Construction Resources: Alys Beach Construction - The community's internal building division staffed with engineers, builders, craftsmen, and project managers who oversee every construction detail on-site. Approved Builders - Eight vetted external builders certified to construct homes in the community. Safety Standards: All homes meet the Fortified® for Safer Living certification—an insurance industry standard developed by the Institute for Business and Home Safety. This means construction exceeds standard building codes with features like reinforced walls and fireproof materials to protect against natural disasters. Construction Philosophy: Beauty is found in the details, and the details define life here at Alys Beach. The community partners with skilled craftspeople committed to integrity throughout the building process. Structural Features: Homes feature solid masonry roofs and walls designed to withstand severe weather while adding long-term property value.

pages.title: Sales Team – Alys Beach
pages.content: This page introduces Alys Beach's dedicated sales team, emphasizing their expertise and commitment to helping clients find properties within this coastal community. Team Philosophy: The sales agents are described as being deeply committed to ensuring thoughtful, tailored service, whether assisting clients with vacation getaways or permanent residences. Team Expertise: The collective experience is substantial: over 45 years of combined experience selling real estate exclusively within Alys Beach. This specialization reflects their understanding that purchasing property here represents an investment in the town itself. Community Investment: Over $100 million invested in our community's amenities including an owners-only Gulf front Beach Club alongside world-class special events and programming designed to celebrate community and connectivity. Sales Agents Featured: Field Williams, Tom Dodson (Vice President of Sales), Robbie Roberts, Ben Bricken. Call to Action: Visitors can contact the sales team through a dedicated inquiry form or call the general line at 850-213-5500. The page encourages prospective buyers to explore available properties and connect with agents to discuss their specific real estate needs.

pages.title: Alys Beach: A Curated Coastal Community
pages.content: Alys Beach is a meticulously designed beachfront community in Florida's Emerald Coast, representing where the grandeur of nature and man-made excellence meet. The 20-year-old development emphasizes architectural coherence, environmental stewardship, and community-focused amenities. Architecture & Design: The community showcases geometric precision with stark white structures against blue skies. The architectural vision prioritizes clean lines and purposeful spatial composition that creates a distinctive skyline along the Gulf coast. Natural Elements: A 20-acre nature preserve features an elevated 1,800-foot boardwalk through varied habitats including wiregrass meadows and wildflowers. Nine town parks serve as recreational and social hubs, with an amphitheater hosting regular performances. Community Infrastructure: ZUMA Wellness Center & Racquets Facility, The Beach Club, Caliza Pool, Alys Shoppe and dining establishments, Multiple galleries and art installations. Cultural Emphasis: Art integration throughout the landscape reflects the community's commitment to aesthetic and cultural enrichment. The Alys Foundation supports community, environmental, educational, and cultural initiatives both locally and regionally. Recognition: The community has received significant media attention from prestigious publications including Architectural Digest (named #3 in the 55 Most Beautiful Small Towns in America), Vogue, Town & Country, and Robb Report. Contact Information: 9581 County Highway 30A East, Alys Beach, FL 32461 | General: 850.213.5500 | Rentals: 850.213.5555

pages.title: Architecture – Alys Beach
pages.content: Alys Beach is a New Urban community combining Bermudan architectural forms with courtyard living principles. The community emphasizes architectural excellence and a deep respect for the natural environment. House Types Section: The community offers three residential options: Villas - Traditional freestanding homes with yards on all sides; Courtyard Homes - Built to lot edges, organized around private central courtyards with galleries, terraces, gardens, fountains, and pools; Compounds - Larger properties featuring multiple pavilion buildings connected by loggias and garden walls. Interiors: Homes feature a modern, seaside aesthetic – open, whitewashed spaces highlighted by the textures and colors of natural, local materials including limestone floors, cypress beams, doors, and patterned cement tiles. Town Architects: Erik Vogt and Marieanne Khoury-Vogt of KVA developed the architectural vision through impeccable, thoughtful design, and the understanding of how the outdoors interacts intimately with interior spaces. Planning: Duany Plater Zyberk and Company (DPZ) created the master plan, bringing together architecture, engineering, landscape, and community disciplines for successful town planning. Construction Standards: All homes meet Fortified… for Safer Living® certification—an insurance industry standard exceeding building codes with solid masonry construction, additional wall reinforcement, and fireproof materials.

pages.title: Alys Beach - The Beach
pages.content: THE BEACH. Alys Beach features pristine white sand beaches along the Gulf of Mexico. The community sits on a beachfront bluff rising nearly 30 feet above the gulf, offering spectacular views of the sand and sea below. Featured Quote: Sky above. Sand below. Peace within. Amen. Beach Access Points: The property offers multiple convenient access points including Gulf Green, Turtle Bale, and Béla Gray for homeowners and vacation guests. Homeowners receive exclusive access via the Beach Club. Food & Beverage Service: Beach Food & Beverage Delivery allows guests to spend more time enjoying the simplicity of life at the beach, offering creative coastal cuisine delivered directly to beachgoers. Recreation Rentals: Available equipment includes oversized umbrellas, comfortable beach chairs, kayaks, body boards, stand-up paddle boards, and wetsuits. The Beach Club: Described as one of the town's most unique and beautiful amenities, the Beach Club provides exclusive access for Alys Beach homeowners and is now open to residents only. Additional Features: Live beach camera available; 158 total acres within walking distance of the private beach; Clear water and white sand typical of Northwest Florida's coastline.

pages.title: The Beach Club at Alys Beach
pages.content: The Beach Club is an exclusive amenity for Alys Beach property owners, offering Gulf-facing experiences from sunrise to sunset. It represents a distinctive community gathering space uniquely integrated into the town's architecture. Sunset Terrace: An open-air dining venue providing unobstructed Gulf views. Owners can enjoy cocktails and meals while watching the sky transition through color changes across the horizon. Pool Areas: Multiple swimming facilities positioned to maximize sightlines toward the emerald waters. The main rectangular pool is flanked by palm trees, with a separate sunken deck area and jetted spas also oriented toward Gulf vistas. The Lounge: A social space overlooking both the town's northern skyline and southern Gulf views. The open-air environment hosts billiards, pre-dinner gatherings, sporting events, and exclusive owner celebrations. Architectural Perspective: Architect Tim Slattery of Hart Howerton describes the concept: The Beach Club is where the town meets the beach; a wonderful confluence of where the sculptural, white plaster forms of your environment meet the undulating white dunes. The design intentionally blurs boundaries between architectural elements and natural landscape features, creating a seamless transition between built and natural environments.

pages.title: Caliza Pool – Alys Beach
pages.content: Caliza Pool stands as one of Alys Beach's most celebrated amenities. The facility transports visitors to an exotic oasis experience with thoughtfully designed spaces for relaxation and recreation. Main Pool Centerpiece: The defining feature is a 100-foot, zero entry pool that serves as the focal point. A furnished loggia provides shaded refuge, while winding stairs lead to a rooftop terrace overlooking the town and the Gulf beyond. Additional Pools: Lap Pool - A 75-foot swimming area featuring a poolside iPod port for underwater music listening, shaded by wood trellis and bamboo hedge; Family Pool - Shallow waters with fountain spouts and draped awnings for sun protection and children's play. Dining & Hospitality: An open-air restaurant and bar operates under shaded loggias and private cabanas, overlooking preserved natural areas to the north. Design Recognition: Khoury Vogt Architects (KVA) designed the facility, which earned the prestigious Palladio Award for its design and construction. The name derives from the Spanish word caliza, meaning limestone—the primary material used in construction that reflects light wavelengths creating the distinctive aesthetic. Location: 9581 County Hwy 30A East, Alys Beach, Florida 32461

pages.title: ZUMA Wellness Center & Racquets Facility - Alys Beach
pages.content: ZUMA is an exclusive 15,000-square-foot wellness and racquet sports facility located at 88 North Castle Harbour Drive in Alys Beach, Florida. The facility operates Monday-Friday from 6 AM to 7 PM and Saturday-Sunday from 7 AM to 6 PM. Wellness Center Components: The Lift Room, Movement Room, Cardio Room, and Recovery Room; Outdoor swimming pool designed for lap swimming and aquatic instruction; Two treatment rooms and steam rooms; Café with smoothies, coffee, and grab-and-go snacks; Retail offerings including lululemon athletica and OSEA skincare products. Classes & Training: The facility offers yoga, TRX suspension training, boxing, and Bogafit aquatics programming led by certified instructors. Racquets Facility: Four American Red Clay tennis courts; Three pickleball courts; Activity lawn with seating and viewing pavilions. Professional Staff: Leadership includes Patrick Hoffner (Head Fitness Professional with TRX and precision nutrition certifications), Tyler Marengo (Director of Racquets with extensive tournament experience), Cole Gromley (Racquet Sports Professional), and Kelli DeWispelare (Assistant Fitness Professional with 18 years of Pilates instruction experience). Accessibility: An exclusive amenity for Alys Beach homeowners and vacation rental guests, ZUMA does not offer day passes or outside memberships. For scheduling and information, contact 850-213-5678.

pages.title: Merchants – Alys Beach
pages.content: This is the merchants directory page for Alys Beach, a luxury Florida coastal community. The page features an interactive map and detailed listings of local businesses. Section Heading: THE MERCHANTS OF ALYS. Description: Carefully curated and each an integral part of our Alys Beach community, all of our remarkable merchants share our vision of a life defined by beauty, simplicity, balance, and grace. Merchant Categories: Retail, Food & Beverage, Amenities. Featured Merchants (15 total): Notable establishments include: Alys Shoppe - Retail (Open daily 10am-7pm); George's - Restaurant featuring brilliantly creative, fresh coastal fare with outdoor patio dining; Fonville Press - Market, café, and coffee shop for gathering and celebration; O-Ku - Japanese restaurant with sushi and traditional cuisine; NEAT - Bottle shop and tasting room; The Citizen - Coastal tavern with raw bar and wood-fired kitchen. Interactive Features: The page includes an embedded map with merchant location markers and filtering options by business type.

pages.title: Alys Beach Vacation Rental & Homeowner Amenities
pages.content: This page describes the amenities available to Alys Beach property owners and vacation rental guests in a coastal Florida community. Beach Club: The property features a main pool area operating daily 9am-7pm with bar service from 11am-6pm. Sunset Terrace operates Tuesday - Saturday Bar/Lounge: 5 pm - 9 pm with dining available 5:30pm-9pm. Access is exclusively for homeowners. Additional Facilities: The community offers several complementary services: a bike shop (9am-5pm daily), Caliza Pool & Restaurant with lunch service, Guest Services for general inquiries, a Sales Center, ZUMA Café (6am-7pm weekdays), and the ZUMA Wellness Center & Racquets Facility for fitness and recreational activities. Beach Food & Beverage: Delivery service is available exclusively for property owners and vacation renters at the Beach Club Plaza location. Location & Contact: The amenities are mapped across Alys Beach's layout, with an interactive map displaying exact coordinates. General: 850.213.5500 and Rentals: 850.213.5555 serve as primary contact numbers. Restrictions: Most facilities note they are Exclusively for Alys Beach homeowners and vacation rental guests, with ZUMA specifically stating it does not offer day passes or outside memberships.

pages.title: Alys Beach Merchants - Food & Beverage
pages.content: This is the merchants directory for Alys Beach, a Florida coastal community. The page features an interactive map and detailed listings of local businesses. Food & Beverage merchants include: Charlie's Delights - Open daily 7am-9pm at 67 N Somerset, Ste 102. Donut shop with extended hours. Fonville Press - Market and café operating 7am-8pm daily with dinner ordering available 4-8pm. George's - Coastal restaurant with lunch (11am-3pm) and dinner (5pm-9pm) service featuring fresh seafood. O-Ku - Modern Japanese meets new urban architecture overlooking the town's Amphitheatre. Hours vary by day. The Citizen - Coastal tavern with raw bar and wood-fired hearth. Lunch/brunch Wed-Sun, dinner daily. NEAT - Wine tasting room and bottle shop with happy hour 1pm-5pm on select days. Raw & Juicy - Juice and health-focused café, open 8am-5pm daily. Retail merchants include: Alys Shoppe, Barefoot Princess, Holiday Shop, Merit jewelry, Parasol boutique, and SummerStory home furnishings. Contact Information: General: 850-213-5500 | Rentals: 850-213-5555.

pages.title: Alys Beach Journals
pages.content: This is the Journals section of the Alys Beach website, featuring a curated collection of digital publications about the coastal community. Current Featured Issue: The Seventeenth Edition (Summer 2022) serves as the lead publication, showcasing seasonal content from the Alys Beach area. Available Journals: The site archives multiple editions spanning from May 2020 to February 2022, including: Sixteenth Edition (February 2022), Fifteenth Edition (December 2021), Fourteenth Edition (November 2021), Thirteenth Edition (September 2021). Thematic Focus: According to the publication descriptions, September in these parts feels more Indian summer than fall, though the bustle slows as the community transitions seasonally. The journals explore architecture, local merchants, wellness facilities, and lifestyle topics relevant to residents and visitors. Key Features: The publications cover local events including the 30A Wine Festival, Digital Graffiti exhibitions, and wedding planning resources. Content includes fashion perspectives, dining experiences, and community initiatives. Subscription: Readers can sign up to receive journals directly via email through a newsletter signup form.

pages.title: Alys Beach News
pages.content: This is the News section of the Alys Beach website, a luxury coastal community in Florida. The page features recent press coverage and events related to Alys Beach. Featured Stories: The page highlights two main stories: Robb Report Features Alys Beach - Recent media coverage from a prominent luxury publication; Vogue Features Alys Beach - Coverage from the fashion and lifestyle magazine. Recent Press & Coverage: The site displays numerous recent media mentions, including features in: Travel + Leisure, Condé Nast Traveler, VIE Magazine, Wall Street Journal, Tatler, Architectural Digest, Town & Country, Ocean Home Magazine, California Home + Design. Events: Notable upcoming events include: 30A Wine Festival (February 18, 2026), Digital Graffiti, Wedding services, Crafted (local artisan event). Contact Information: General inquiries: 850-213-5500 | Vacation rentals: 850-213-5555 | Location: 9581 County Hwy 30A East, Alys Beach, Florida 32461. The page emphasizes Alys Beach's recognition in luxury publications and its status as a premier coastal destination.

pages.title: Weddings – Alys Beach
pages.content: Weddings at Alys Beach. The page states that Weddings can only be held in Alys Beach for members of the Alys Beach community of owners. Specifically, the venue now restricts ceremonies to those who own residences or homesites within the town boundaries. Important Policy Notice: Please understand that we are unable to make any exceptions to this policy, including sponsorships. The organization invites current property owners to contact them regarding their future wedding celebrations. Footer Information: Address: 9581 County Hwy 30A East, Alys Beach, Florida 32461 | General Contact: 850-213-5500 | Rentals Contact: 850-213-5555. Additional Navigation: The page includes links to other sections including real estate listings, vacation properties, events like the 30A Wine Festival and Digital Graffiti, and amenities such as the Caliza Pool and ZUMA Wellness Center.

pages.title: Alys Beach: Twenty Years of Life Defined
pages.content: Alys Beach is a master-planned coastal community in Florida celebrating two decades of development. The site presents a film project documenting the community's founding vision and key contributors. Project Theme: Before the land where Alys Beach stands was purchased at auction in 1978, a family's dream developed here on the beach—in cottages and open-air jeep rides and in the stories etched now in memories. The initiative emphasizes how countless talented and visionary leaders built a community without compromise, committed to creating a place where every detail matters. Featured Founders & Leadership: The page highlights 14 key figures, including: Jim & Julie Stephens — Developers; Jim is Chairman Emeritus of EBSCO; Jason Comer — Alys Beach Town Founder and CEO of Comer Companies; Marieanne Khoury-Vogt & Erik Vogt — Town Architects at Khoury Vogt Architects; Andrés Duany — Founding Partner of DPZ Codesign, original master planners; Additional staff in sales, events, construction, and community planning. Navigation Highlights: The site offers access to real estate listings, vacation property bookings, community information, and events like the 30A Wine Festival and Digital Graffiti festival. Contact: General: 850-213-5500 | Rentals: 850-213-5555

pages.title: Look at the Life We Built – Alys Beach
pages.content: LIFE DEFINED. Alys Beach is a New Urbanist coastal community located on Florida's Gulf Coast along Highway 30A. The site emphasizes luxury amenities blended with natural beauty and walkable design. Key Descriptive Text: The community is characterized as an exquisite, New Urbanist community on the pristine, white sands and emerald waters of the Florida Gulf Coast where luxury feels simple. Community Focus Areas: The development highlights architecture integrated with nature, describing how exquisite architecture and the grandeur of nature come together, creating a place where children find laughter, families find each other, and we discover the pure blessing of living. Main Service Categories: Real Estate (listings and ownership opportunities), Vacation rentals and accommodations, Beach Club facilities, Wellness center and racquet facilities (ZUMA), Food and beverage merchants, Events and cultural programming. Contact Information: General: 850-213-5500 | Rentals: 850-213-5555 | Address: 9581 County Hwy 30A East, Alys Beach, Florida 32461

The site promotes ownership opportunities alongside vacation rental options. Amenities & Attractions: The community features the Beach Club, Caliza Pool, ZUMA Wellness Center & Racquets Facility, and various merchant options. A live beach cam provides real-time coastal views. Notable events include the 30A Wine Festival, Digital Graffiti, and wedding services through their specialized coordinator. Additional Resources: Visitors can access town maps, careers page, photography guidelines, and detailed privacy/cookie policies.

pages.title: Privacy Policy – Alys Beach
pages.content: Privacy Policy last updated November 17, 2023. Information Collection: The policy outlines that Alys Beach collects personal identifiers and internet activity information through voluntary disclosure and automatic capture methods like IP addresses and device information. Data Usage: The organization uses collected information for processing your transactions, establishing the identity of account holders, customer service, authorization, customer support, content processing. Security Measures: The site implements appropriate technical and organizational measures including limited access, electronic security systems, and TLS/SSL encryption for payment transactions. User Rights: Individuals may exercise rights including access, correction, deletion, and data portability depending on their jurisdiction. The company explicitly states it does not sell personal information to third parties. Children's Privacy: Alys Beach does not knowingly collect information from children under 16 years except when provided directly by parents or guardians for amenity cards. Contact Information: Users can exercise privacy rights through a web portal, toll-free phone (1-833-705-0124), mail, or email at the provided address. Third-Party Tracking: The site uses cookies and analytics tools, with opt-out available through OneTrust's privacy management platform and smart-pixl.com's consumer options page.

pages.title: Cookie Policy – Alys Beach
pages.content: This is Alys Beach's Cookie Policy page, last updated January 1, 2020. What Cookies Are Used For: The site explains that cookies are small electronic files that are stored on your computer or mobile device that collect information about your preferences and navigation of websites. Four Cookie Categories: Strictly Necessary - Essential for website functionality and security; cannot be disabled. Performance - Track user interaction and improve website functionality. Functionality - Remember user settings, preferences, and login information. Targeting - Deliver relevant advertising; may track browsing across other websites. Third-Party Use: Alys Beach employs cookies from third-party providers for marketing purposes, including remarketing with Google Analytics and social media features like Facebook's like button. User Controls: Visitors can adjust cookie settings through web browser controls or third-party tools like the Network Advertising Initiative's Opt-Out Tool. The policy notes that disabling certain cookies may impact website functionality. Contact: Questions about the policy can be directed to the provided email address for privacy inquiries. The policy is straightforward and accessible, with a downloadable PDF version available.

pages.title: Terms of Use – Alys Beach
pages.content: This is the Terms of Use agreement for Alys Beach, a coastal development in Florida, effective December 27, 2019. The document governs use of websites including alysbeach.com, alysshoppe.com, and calizarestaurant.com. User Requirements & Account Security: Users must be 18+ to access the site. The company reserves the right to withdraw or restrict access. Users are responsible for maintaining confidentiality of login credentials and must notify the company of unauthorized access immediately. Intellectual Property: The Website and its entire contents, features and functionality...are protected by contract law and United States and international copyright, trademark, patent, trade secret and other intellectual property or proprietary rights laws. Users may view and download materials for personal use only, provided they retain copyright notices. Prohibited Activities: The terms explicitly prohibit automated data collection, scraping, impersonation, malware introduction, unauthorized access attempts, and commercial use without written consent. User-Generated Content: Content posted by users becomes non-confidential and grants the company rights to use, reproduce, modify, and distribute such material. Liability Limitations: The company disclaims warranties for website accuracy and availability on an AS IS basis. It limits liability for damages of any kind arising from website use. Governing Law: The agreement is governed by Alabama law, with exclusive jurisdiction in federal or state courts in Birmingham, Jefferson County.

pages.title: Alys Beach Careers
pages.content: Alys Beach is recruiting for multiple positions across various departments. The organization emphasizes creating places and spaces that bring joy and meaning to the guest and resident experiences. Core Values: The company operates with a stated purpose driven by excellence in accountability, commitment, integrity, passion, respect, and unity. Benefits: Compensation packages include benefits coverage beginning on the first day of employment. Open Positions by Department: Food & Beverage (5 positions) - Caliza Steward, Caliza Cook I, Beach Club Bartender/Server PM, Beach Club Steward, Beach Club Cook I. Security (2 positions) - Construction Compliance Assistant, Security Guard - E-Bike Patrol. Accounting (2 positions) - Cost Accountant, Accounts Payable Specialist. Maintenance (2 positions) - Swimming Pool Technician, Maintenance Tech. Other Departments - General Laborer (Construction), Recreation Attendant - Full-Time, Pool and Beach Gate Attendant (Guest Services), Client Relations Support - Residential Construction. Location: 9581 County Hwy 30A East, Alys Beach, Florida 32461. Contact: General: 850.213.5500 | Rentals: 850.213.5555

pages.title: Photography Policy – Alys Beach
pages.content: Alys Beach maintains strict guidelines regarding photography to protect the privacy of property owners and maintain community standards. Prohibited Photography: No photography in front of privately owned homes or on private streets; No commercial, influencer, or content creator photography for promotional purposes; No drone or aerial photography; No hair, makeup, wardrobe changes, or professional lighting/equipment for casual shoots. Permitted Photography: Residents and vacation rental guests may conduct personal photoshoots with professional photographers for family photos, graduations, and engagements. Wedding photography is restricted to property owners only. Professional Requirements: Real estate agents may photograph only the homes they're listing (interiors and immediate exteriors). Editorial and real estate photography requires prior permission through a photography request form submitted to Marketing. Vacation rental guests using professional photographers must select from a pre-approved list available through their vacation concierge. Enforcement: Unauthorized photographers and their subjects will be asked to leave property. Unauthorized use of photography for public promotional purposes is subject to legal action. Contact: Email [email protected] for photography inquiries.
